Live Blog

SILVIO GONE

Silvio Berlusconi dead latest — World reacts as former Italian PM dies, 86, after being hospitalised twice in two months

CONTROVERSIAL former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi has died aged 86 in hospital, following a battle with cancer.

Former Italian leader Berlusconi - who has three separate terms as PM -was rushed to San Raffaele hospital in Milan just weeks after leaving the intensive care unit following a blood cancer diagnosis.

The controversial European leader had been suffering from leukaemia "for some time" and recently developed a lung infection.

Berlusconi reportedly spent four days at the same hospital in April for treatment, according to news agency Ansa.

His death follows a series of health scares in recent years.

Read our Silvio Berlusconi live blog below for the latest news and updates...

This blog is now closed...

Our live blog on the death of former Italian PM Silvio Berlusconi is now closed.

For more content on the politician head here.

Who is Luigi Berlusconi?

Born in 1988, Luigi is the youngest child of the ex-MP.

In 2011 he graduated in Economics and Finance from the Università Luigi Bocconi in Milan.

From 2010 to 2012 he has been a member of the Board of Directors of MolMed S.p.A., which is quoted on the Milan stock exchange.

In June 2012 he was appointed to the Board of Directors of Fininvest S.p.A.

What was Silvio Berlusconi's net worth?

The late politician is said to be worth £5 billion.

In 2017, Forbes magazine ranked him as the 199th richest man in the world.

‘It’s tough, but I’ll make it’

The 86-year-old media mogul who spent three nights in intensive care with pneumonia after a diagnosis of leukaemia told his fans he believed he would recover.

“It’s tough, but I’ll make it once again,” he told Italian Il Giornales from Milan‘s San Raffaele Hospital before his death.

“I managed, also in delicate and difficult situations, to pull myself up, “he told the newspaper in a phone call from his hospital bed.

How many children does Silvio Berlusconi have?

Berlusconi has a total of five children.

Daughter Maria Elvira, known as Marina, is his eldest child, born on August 10, 1966, to his first wife, Carla.

She is chairwoman of Fininvest Holding, and an Italian holding company controlled by the Berlusconi family .

Silvio and Carla's second child, son Pier Silvio, arrived three years later on April 28, 1969.

Pier sits on multiple boards and is the Deputy Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of MFE-MediaForEurope N.V. (Broadcasting).

Berlusconi also has three children with Veronica, all born before the couple married.

Who are Silvio Berlusconi’s ex-wives?

Silvio Berlusconi was born on September 29, 1936, in Milan, Italy.

He died on June 12, 2023, and was "married" three times during his lifetime.

Alongside his marriages, the controversial former Italian Prime Minister and billionaire businessman has been linked to a number of other women.

He dated Francesca Pascale for 12 years but dumped her in 2020 for third "wife", Marta Fascina.

Here are his ex-wives:

Carla Elvira Dall'Oglio

Veronica Lario

Marta Fascina

What was Silvio Berlusconi's cause of death and when did he die?

Berlusconi died on June 9, 2023, after being rushed to hospital.

No official cause of death has been revealed but he had been suffering from leukaemia "for some time" and recently developed a lung infection.

The flamboyant Forza Italia leader was admitted to hospital last week for what his aides said were pre-planned tests related to his illness.

But it came just three weeks after he was discharged following a six-week stay at the same hospital - during which time doctors found he had a rare type of blood cancer and he underwent intensive therapy.

What years did Berlusconi serve as the PM?

Berlusconi was also temporarily banned from politics after a conviction of tax fraud in 2013.

He served a community sentence and muscled his way back into the spotlight before being re-elected as a senator in 2022.

The billionaire served as Italy’s Prime Minister on three occasions, from 1994 to 1995, 2001 to 2006, and 2008 to 2011.

Who is Pier Silvio Berlusconi?

Born in 1969, Pier is the son of the former Italian prime minister and his first wife.

He is the CEO and President of RTI and Vice President of Mediaset Groups.

Since 2002 he has been in a relationship with TV presenter Silvia Toffanin.

Who are Silvio Berlusconi's children?

Silvio had two children from his first marriage to Carla Elvira Dall’Oglio, and three from his second wife Veronica Lario.

Marina Berlusconi

Born in 1966, Marina is the daughter of Silvio and his first wife Carla Elvira Lucia Dall'Oglio.

She is the chairwoman of Fininvest Holding and of the Arnoldo Mondadori Editore publishing group.

In 2013, 2016, and 2018 The Hollywood Reporter included Marina in its 20 most influential women in the media TV industry.

Berlusconi's grand Pharaoh-inspired marble mausoleum

Former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi has died at the age of 86.

The scandal-hit billionaire media mogul - famous for his notorious "bunga bunga" parties - was dashed to Milan's San Raffaele Hospital on Friday.

While it's too soon for details of the funeral, Berlusconi built a grand Pharaoh-inspired marble mausoleum at his villa in Arcore, near Milan, for his family and friends when they die.

What was his cause of death?

His death follows a series of health scares in recent years.

Despite being re-elected to the Senate last year, he was rarely seen in public.

Back in April, Berlusconi reportedly spent four days at the same Milan hospital for heart problems.

There has been no official confirmation of his cause of death.

Tributes from across the world

Roberto Metsola, president of the European Parliament, said "he has left his mark and will not be forgotten".

Viktor Orban, the Hungarian prime minister, said: "Gone is the great fighter. Rest in peace, my friend."

Relationship with Putin

Silvio Berlusconi also stood resolutely by his old friend Putin - despite his invasion of Ukraine.

"Putin for my birthday sent me 20 bottles of vodka and a very sweet letter," he said in October last year.

"I replied with bottles of Lambrusco and an equally sweet letter."

Was Berlusconi married?

Berlusconi was first married in 1965 to Carla DallOglio, and their two kids, Marina and Piersilvio, hold top positions in his business empire.

He married his second wife, Veronica Lario, in 1990, and they had three children - Barbara, Eleonora and Luigi.

Did Berlusconi have Covid?

Berlusconi was hospitalised for Covid-related pneumonia in September 2020, but later recovered.

However, the following year he was admitted several times for complications stemming from the deadly virus.

Berlusconi was forced to undergo open heart surgery in 2016 and surgery on his intestine three years later.

The four-time prime minister, who is fitted with a pacemaker, has also overcome prostate cancer.

'It's tough, but I'll make it'

The 86-year-old media mogul who spent three nights in intensive care with pneumonia after a diagnosis of leukaemia told his fans he believed he would recover.

"It's tough, but I'll make it once again," he told Italian Il Giornales from Milan's San Raffaele Hospital before his death.

"I managed, also in delicate and difficult situations, to pull myself up, "he told the newspaper in a phone call from his hospital bed.

Defence Minister's tribute

Guido Crosetto took to Twitter to share a tribute to Berlusconi.

He said: "A big, huge pain. He leaves a huge void because he was great.

"An era is over, an era is closing. I loved him very much. Goodbye Silvio."

What years did Berlusconi serve as the PM?

Berlusconi was also temporarily banned from politics after a conviction of tax fraud in 2013.

He served a community sentence and muscled his way back into the spotlight before being re-elected as a senator in 2022.

The billionaire served as Italy's Prime Minister on three occasions, from 1994 to 1995, 2001 to 2006, and 2008 to 2011.

Deputy Prime Minister shares tribute

Taking to Twitter, deputy Prime Minister, Matteo Salvini paid tribute to Silvio Berlusconi following his death.

Salvini said: "One of the greatest ever, in all fields, from all points of view, without equal.

"But above all today I lose a great friend. I'm broken and I rarely cry, today is one of those days.

"I keep as a precious gift the value of your friendship, your advice, your generosity, your respect, your genius, your rare and affectionate reproaches immediately followed by compliments and unique attentions.

"You have done so much for Italy and for the Italians, you leave a void that is difficult to fill, starting today we will dedicate all our efforts and all our efforts to continue the thousand roads that you first saw and traced."

'Huge void' left after death

Italian Defence Minister Guido Crosetto said Berlusconi's death leaves a "huge void".

"I loved him very much. Farewell Silvio," Crosetto said.

Silvio Berlusconi once promised a ‘bus full of prostitutes’ to Monza players

Former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi once promised his Monza players a "bus full of prostitutes" if they were to beat AC Milan or Juventus.

The 86-year-old, who owned AC Milan between 1986 and 2017, bought Monza in 2018.

Berlusconi came out with an outlandish statement in a bid to try and motivate his side to beat one of the big Italian clubs after their promotion.

He said: "We found a new coach, who was at our youth team, he is good, smart, kind, and able to stimulate [motivate] our lads.

"I decided to add an extra stimulation.

"So I told the lads you will play Milan, Juventus, etc, so if you beat one of these big teams, I will have you greeted in the locker room by a bus full of wh***s."

Silvio Berlusconi once owned AC-Milan

The 86-year-old, who owned AC Milan between 1986 and 2017, bought the team in 2018.

Berlusconi, the three-time Italian premier, sold AC Milan to a Chinese-led consortium for £615m in 2017.

Tributes paid to Berlusconi

Tributes have been made to the former Italiam PM after his death was announced.

Taking to social media one fan said: "Riposa in pace Silvio!"

A second, using his phrase, said: "He's off to the big bunga bunga party."

Self proclaimed 'Jesus Christ of politics'

The ex-PM, who previously described himself as the "Jesus Christ of politics", also landed himself in hot water in 2010.

It was alleged that the lothario had abused his position of power to protect a young Moroccan nightclub dancer who was arrested.

Police detained Karima El-Mahroug, known by her stage name 'Ruby the Heart Stealer', for theft - but she was released after Berlusconi claimed she was the niece of then Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak.

He was charged with paying her for sex when she was just 17 and was found guilty, until he was acquitted in 2014.

An appeals court ruled there was no proof he knew El-Mahroug was a minor.

Berlusconi was also temporarily banned from politics after a conviction of tax fraud in 2013.
